div.p: Trends in benthic blue carbon change. Change in blue carbon benthic standing stock (tonnes per square kilometre) around the Southern Ocean. Each cell is 3° × 3°. Cell data based on: (i) yellow–red are increases from direct (increased standing stock from sampling benthos) and indirect (iceberg grounding data) evidence streams, Fillinger et al. [ 19], Barnes [ 5, 9], Barnes & Sands [ 9]; (ii) white with question mark are samples awaiting analysis (from Antarctic Circumnavigation Expedition cruise 2016–2017) and expected samples from British Antarctic Survey JR17004 scientific cruise; (iii) light to dark blue are decreases from giant iceberg grounding probabilities given by US National Ice Center ( figure 4 a).
